metadata.title: CVE-2016-7143 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The m_authenticate function in modules/m_sasl.c in Charybdis before 3.5.3allows remote attackers to spoof certificate fingerprints and consequentlylog in as another user via a crafted AUTHENTICATE parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

charybdis - 3.5.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: charybdis package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.3-1').
